documents.document: How @boydie71 got away with this offering, I'll never know. @PleaseDontHugMe #podcast https://t.co/lPQ4g02pOy
Sigh of the week. No doubt about it.
18:21hrs. That sigh was brief but there was real intent behind it.
Friday night. #podcast editing night. With a BOUFFANT. How did this become my life?

Thank you everyone who RTd the last tweet.
Appreciated.

This is Neil's story.
Please RT if you can. Thank you.
https://t.co/f5aVcHSCLJ
#DRTisAvailable #podcast https://t.co/zhJkqEzI9n
Neil has been diagnosed with Multiple Sclerosis, (primary progressive ms) for which there is no treatment here in the UK.
> In it, I ask my childhood friend Neil, 'Nelly, Remember this?' and recount our old south #Ldn exploits from back in the day.
Fans of my Daniel Ruiz Tizon is Available #podcast will be aware that this year, I have introduced a new feature, 'Nelly, Remember this?' >
#ICYMI The rise of the ENSUITE BATHROOM. Via @Storify. https://t.co/c57652knu1 #HousingCrisis https://t.co/yQYHS0FrWV
The graffiti, I'd like to point out, was incorrect. My dad did 18 years at college before they turfed him as he'd done every course they had
In the end, the worst we were exposed to on that corner was some graffiti at my dad's expense, mocking him for spending 21 years at college.
I spent 24 years living on a house right on the corner of an #SW9 street and I always feared we were vulnerable to a mural.
It kills me when I walk past a house that's had a mural painted on it.
1996, I was walking home from a party in #Lambeth with some guys. We walked past a mural when 1 scoffed, "Yeah, that'll stop the violence."
They love a mural in #Lambeth but right from when I was knee high, I have always thought they were s***. #SW9
I remember at the end of Villa Road, opp St John the Evangelist, in the late 70s, some guy painted a giant mural. I HAVE NEVER LIKED MURALS.
And seeing sheets of corrugated iron on houses in #Lambeth in the 70s was a common sight. There were squatters everywhere in the borough.
As a kid of course, I had no idea of what was going on in Villa Road. I just went through it whenever I went to Angell Town. #Brixton #SW9
This was after #Lambeth & the Villa Road squatters had compromised. The north side of the road would be saved, but the south had to go.
I remember Max Roach Park being built in the late 70s. #SW9 #VillaRoad
Brilliant programme on the Villa Road #SW9 squats of #Brixton that I remember well from my childhood. Lefties… https://t.co/LruzAi5MUB
UK home to 80% of top-earning European bankers https://t.co/aZ4uuwG5Za
@boydie71 I've known you 34 years Mick. You've never shocked me like this. My next tweet will be a blank one to register my dismay @O2music
@boydie71 I'm going to have to stage an intervention. Surely @O2music thought you'd confused the Drake gig for Rod Stewart's Feb concert?
@boydie71 And I was working so well today. I can't do a thing now. You at a Drake concert is worse than your body warmer period. @O2music
@boydie71 Honestly, I'm taken aback you went to a Drake concert. It's up there with Harrison Ford getting his ear p… https://t.co/VIE29gFpEM
@boydie71 #Brexit, #Trump, shock after shock. But none bigger than you going to a Drake concert. I don't know the world any more. @O2music
@boydie71 You were obviously chaperoning youngsters to the concert. If I'm wrong, please don't tell me. @O2music
@boydie71 Did you genuinely tweet this? @O2music
Trump doctor reveals secret to US president's hair https://t.co/jIzYBkiOv9
@StockwellNews #Stockwell writer with book out. 'Me! Me! Me!' Find it here: https://t.co/CfB3DIioj5 #SW9 https://t.co/WTVCeza7Y3
Live at 10am. #BibiDoesSoho https://t.co/IOlnTP7FiD
Network Rail and the Brixton and Herne Hill arches: it's a shambles https://t.co/Gx6ezbLBC4 via @brixtonbuzz #SW9
The ensuite bathroom also has a potentially ruinous impact on relationships, new and old. #HousingCrisis
Sure, in a spare room, the ensuite bathroom comes into its own. But not as your ONLY bathroom. #HousingCrisis
A tomb offering no views to the cranes that have corralled your neighbourhood and carved up old homes into boxes. #HousingCrisis
The ensuite bathroom is a tomb. A windowless tomb.
To me, the ensuite bathroom is a daily reminder of just how insignificant you are. What you're up against. #HousingCrisis
Despite 25+ years of the communal bathroom, I never felt ensuite was the answer.
I should add, my dad himself always felt the communal bathroom was a good way to meet the neighbours. I myself didn’t quite see it that way.
> you’d have thought I’d champion the ensuite bathroom.
> needing to leave the bedsit to reach it, handing out maps to visitors requiring the loo so they didn't get lost >
As someone who grew up with the communal bathroom and endured it for two and a half decades+ >
Can you endure being line managed by someone younger than you who’s still living at home, when you’ve got an ensuite bathroom?
As you stand in your windowless bathroom, your bed on the other side of that door, can that ready you for the real world? #HousingCrisis
You get out of bed and reach your bathroom in an instant, where is that sense of purpose? Where is the momentum? #HousingCrisis
You need to feel you’re getting something substantial for your rent.
The momentum it gives you at the start of your day.
Personally, I think you need that walk to the bathroom. #HousingCrisis
But is that a good thing?
Now you can be out of bed and in the ensuite bathroom within a tweet. #HousingCrisis
As our accommodation shrinks in this country, the ENSUITE BATHROOM is growing in popularity. #HousingCrisis
@Docroddy That was an excellent team.
@BibiLynch With difficulty, I would imagine.
Phil Parkes rocking the Braveheart look. https://t.co/amme9NkIRK

Brian Little. Villa.
That is a fringe. https://t.co/dOv99ynO77
Terry McDermott, vastly underrated and scorer of spectacular goals. His perm was probably better than this centre p… https://t.co/Jko06UDGAt

5 late night football hairstyles of yesteryear.
Strachan - Aberdeen. https://t.co/3z8tok9T9D
Chelsea's Antonio Conte in a previous life. #cfc https://t.co/u2OhSXw4dQ
Tomorrow. 10am. #bibidoessoho with @BibiLynch #radio https://t.co/72oHK9rN1K
Next time I see people playing frisbee on the dog-wrecked Common, do I just not tweet about it? #Clapham #SW4
It could be now this angry world no longer has a place for middle-aged tweeters drawing attention to the dog muck on #Clapham Common. #SW4
My mouth guard should've been in 14 minutes ago.
Man City are the street addict that constantly roughs up Bubbles (West Ham) in series 4 of #TheWire. #WHUFCvMCFC
@crimsonavenger Yes, I had to microwave my most recent saveloy. Split the sausage's distinctive-coloured skin right down the middle.
@crimsonavenger If we can find other saveloy lovers in major UK cities, it might help turn this little-regarded sausage's fortunes around.
If ever there was a takeaway held back by its appearance, it was the saveloy. https://t.co/vXZpfdZUBP
The mullet common in that decade lent itself brilliantly to that often visualised moment of dashing to a stricken opponent's aide.
One of my 1980s fantasies was being a footballer who saved an opponent from swallowing their tongue, a not uncommon occurrence in that era.
Do your Amazon shopping via https://t.co/Rcfj0NNny6 and a small % comes back to my site at no extra cost to you. https://t.co/ukmhiGIRqT
Libraries minister promises to act if councils cannot justify cuts https://t.co/kcOqtdBwoA #SaveLibraries
I miss the considerable weight of 1970s bedding.

"Like finding venison in Londis."
Daniel Ruiz Tizon is Available #podcast. #iTunes https://t.co/sCQq56GS55 RSS… https://t.co/W2QMu6rPlg
> It's like the 80s when no big live music event could take place without Paul McCartney closing.
We can't seem to have #gentrification without a CostaStarNero taking up a spot on our bland, revamped high streets. #Ldn
An early contender for my Top 5 most memorable moments of 2017. https://t.co/vCqgSWj6BY
Too strong coffee threatening to pull a facial out of me.
#ICYMI Footballers used to have leg hair. Yes they did. https://t.co/xUZYpbKc3A
This morning's slumped posture is down to a combination of a lack of coffee and significant BOUFFANT pressure pushing down on the shoulders.
The teeth don't know what to do with all the extra space.
Suddenly the teeth, like a tenant whose flat mate has moved out, find themselves with a lot more room.
It could be the jaw clench, if not stress-related, could be a consequence of the mouth guard coming out in the mornings.
The sigh and the jaw clench are like two people that shouldn't be together.
I let the sigh pass if it's not accompanied by the jaw clench. If the clench is there, the sigh gets stopped.
08:32hrs. Early morning sigh cut short. Pleased I had enough about me to abort it.
Take care of your elderly mothers and fathers, says Tory minister https://t.co/1nozjikC6V
UK faces return to inequality of Thatcher years, says report https://t.co/DJDZofnYK2
What you got for me, February?
Be off with you, January.
Today's kids won't believe it, but here's proof that just 30 years ago our footballers had leg hair. https://t.co/Z3xvDI8rSi
1930s Brentford players beat Arsenal's modern day stars to the post match selfie by 80 years. https://t.co/zXSYR9I6gx
This 1940s footballer is getting a knee massage from the trainer. Yes, THE KNEE. https://t.co/lTd1TzIpRZ
@WarrenAJB The admiral kit was brilliant but the 80-81 @CPFC Adidas home strip is an incredible kit.
